CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 16, 1955, pg. 17 reads: "Closed Circuit Telecast - Among the some 1200 district doctors, medical technicians and wives and sweethearts who saw a closed circuit report of the polio vaccine's success at the Stanley Theatre were Estelle Jackson, left, and Ruth Hightower, right, both technicians on the Salk team, and Miss Jackson's escort, Thomas Hancock. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Estelle Jackson, Thomas Hancock, and Ruth Hightower, standing outside of the Stanley Theater
